content.description: Start a few paces to the left of Slots of Fun, matched on the fragile, mostly vertical flake down low. Move left, onto 2 medium sized, obvious holds. Get a high right foot on the starting flake, then throw/ standup/reach 6 feet to a 1 pad 2-4 finger hold straight up at the lip (the crux).. A somewhat spicy, and chossy topout awaits.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter is a good idea.

content.description: Just left of Center Start. Use 2 horizontal slots, then move right to the vertical slot.  Up a variety of ways.  I used a right hand pinch.
content.location: black box boulder, NW of area.  Boulder has a black color to it.

content.description: Standing start to foot long ledge in the middle of the boulder.  Straight up.
content.location: black box boulder is located NW of the area.  It has a black sheen to it.  Climb on the south side.

content.description: Start on two half-pad crimps at eye level. Move up and right avoiding the right slanting starting hold of Center Start.
content.location: This route is just right of Center Start (v1) and is roughly in the center-right of the main face of the Black Box boulder.

content.description:
Bold moves on tenuous feet. Start standing with right hand on arete, and left hand on a small sharp sidepull. Get your foot on the rough patch at waist height, climb and finish straight up. You'll be using the arete the whole way, and that thing has varying degrees of positive. Nice rock, very aesthetic line, and flat landing make this a 4 star climb.

The feet get worse as you go higher, forcing you to keep on by just compression and smearing, and it's kind of tall, so get ready for some action.
content.protection: 2 pads, best to have a spotter, but I didn't when I did it, so you'd probably be fine if you kept it in control.
content.location: Right side of Black Box boulder, look for the prominent fin arete, and the small holds on the face. Up high, there is a long obvious left facing crimp/slimper sidepull.

content.description: Another beautiful line on perfect rock on the left side of the back face of the black box in the corridor around the corner. A step onto the face that requires trust, then a full low angle stand up mantel delivers you to the top.
In the Back Alley this route ascends the right side of the beautiful scoop. Don't miss this problem, and don't fall from it.
content.protection: Can't really get a pad in there, so don't fall on this one.
content.location: on the less appreciated back side of the black box, right side of the face back there.

content.description: If you are walking up the trail from the parking lot, this will be the arete you will see on the left corner, with the arete facing the road.  It is just before you would turn the trail to see the wide section of the boulder with many other problems.  Start on a good right hand crimper and bump up the arete with the left hand to top out.  This problem and the Arete Left Side utilize the same arete, just different corners of it and use the opposite hands to bump with if that makes sense.

Start sitting on the left side of the right arete on the main face of the Black Box Boulder. Both hands are matched on a positive undercling. From here, you have a couple of different options.

You can opt for a big dynamic deadpoint to the small, but good crimp above. Or you can use a number of smaller moves and a bit of trickery to reach the crimp.

Upon reaching the crimp, slap right hand up the arete and finish as for the stand start.
content.protection: A coupe of pads are useful
content.location: Located on the far right side of the main face of the Black Box Boulder. Starts sitting on the obvious undercling on the left side of the arete.

content.description: As the name suggests, climb the left side of the arete on the Black Box Boulder.  If on the trail, this will be slightly around the corner if you are facing the boulder (the side with the long face and many other problems).  Bump the right hand up the arete and make use of a small crimper with the left along the way.  Top out
